content: Spent the last few days coding a basic AI model for market analysis. It's rudimentary, but it's a start. Networking event tonight, hoping to make some connections.
Caught up with a friend from college who's now at a quant firm. Got some insider tips on risk management. It's refreshing to have such support.
Visited a quant trading firm for an informal interview. They're interested in my AI background but want more on risk management. Back to the drawing board.
Met with my mentor for lunch. We discussed the integration of AI and risk management. He suggested some resources to explore. Feeling motivated to dive deeper.
Joined a financial technology meetup. Shared my AI trading project and got some constructive feedback. Networking is key in this city.
Working on a comprehensive risk management framework. Today's breakthrough: integrating volatility measures. It's complex, but I'm seeing progress.
Had a setback - my AI model predicted a downturn that didn't happen. Time to refine the algorithm and learn from this misstep.
Revisited my trading strategy with insights from the meetup. Adjusted the AI model to better account for market sentiment. Small victories.
Spent the last few days reaching out to my network for advice on career moves. Got an introduction to a promising firm. Persistence pays off.
Finally, a breakthrough in my risk management framework. Implemented stop-losses and position sizing based on volatility. It's starting to come together.
Had a breakthrough in my AI model. It now accounts for market sentiment better. Shared it with my mentor, and he's impressed. This might be my ticket in.
Met with the quant firm again. They're intrigued by my progress in AI and risk management. They want to see more, but I'm on the right track.

Just finished a multi-day session on behavioral finance. It's reshaping how I view market psychology. Also, got an email from the firm - they're considering me for a trial project. The journey continues.
